column1: # This is an export of the MAG vocab dataset in Anki CSV format (Greek-to-English)

column3: teacher; trainer of a chorus, producer of a play
word, speech, tale, story; reckoning, account, proportion; reason, rationality
small stone, pebble (used in reckoning, in games, in voting); vote
gift; (in political or judicial contexts) bribe
measure, size, distance; moderate amount, proportion
(+ gen.) out of, forth from; as a result of
(+ dat.) in, within, on, at, among
(+ acc.) into, to, toward; with respect to
door; (freq. pl.) double doors, folding doors
event, happening, circumstance; unlucky event, misfortune
faculty of judgment; opinion, decision, verdict
justice, right; lawsuit; punishment (levied in a suit)
begin (+ gen.); rule, be leader of (+ gen.)
drive, set in motion; (intrans) ride, march
flee, flee from; be in exile
(+ gen.) instead of, in place of, in return for
(+ gen.) in front of; in defense of; before (of time or preference)
(+ gen.) through (of time or space); through, by (of agent or means)
(+ acc.) because of, on account of, by aid of, by reason of
ugly; shameful, base, disgraceful (of deeds or things)
worth; worthy, deserving of (takes a genitive complement e.g., ἄξιος τιμης, worthy of honor)
friendly, friendly to (+ dat. of person); beloved
offerings; omens obtained by sacrifice; sacred rites

Cyrus
(son of Achaemenid king Darius II of Persia, who challenged his brother for the throne in 401 B.C.E.)
turn; way, manner, fashion; habits, character
(+ gen.) upon; in the time of
(+ dat.) upon, over; next to; in addition to
(+ acc.) onto, up to, toward; against
(+ gen.) from the side of, from (usually with a person as object)
(+ dat.) by the side of, at the house of (almost always with a person as object)
(+ acc.) to the side of; beside, along
(+ dat.) near, beside; in addition to
(+ acc.) to, toward; against; in respect to, regarding

o!
(accompanies many vocatives; sometimes to be left untranslated in English)

not
(with imperatives, infinitives, must subjunctives and optatives, and other constructions to be learned later)

hear
(usually with acc. of thing heard + gen. of person from whom it is heard, alone or commonly with prep. ἀπό, ἐκ, etc.)
order, command (+ acc. of person + inf.)

it is necessary, it is needful (for one to do something) (+ acc. of person + inf.)
(often to be translated with "ought to", "must", or "should" in a personal construction
it seems good, it seems best (+ dat. of person + inf.)
it is permitted, it is possible (+ dat. or acc. of person + inf.)
it is fitting, it is becoming, it is seemly (+ dat. or acc. of person + inf.)

it is necessary (+ acc. of person + inf.)
(often to be translated with "ought to", "must", or "should" in a personal construction)
hallowed (of things, acts); pious, pure (of persons)
suffer; have (something) done to one, experience
effect, accomplish, do; experience (a certain fortune), fare

(impersonal expression) it is necessary, or compulsory, or unavoidable (+ dat. or acc. of person + inf.)
(often to be translated with "must" in a personal construction)
stone; (if fem.) a particular variety of stone (e.g. magnet, crystall)
responsible; responsible for, cause of (+ objective gen.)
most, greatest, largest; (often with art.) the greatest number, th e most
the majority, the greatest part (of a group)
train (naked), exercise; (mid.) exercise oneself, be in training
judge; serve as judge or juror; (mid.) plead a case, participate in a suit
strike, chop, beat; plunder (land); (mid.) beat one's breast in mourning
prepare, provide, procure; (mid.) prepare for oneself, make preparations
be a citizen; hae a certain form of government; (mid.) live or behave as a free citizen; participate in politics
pour a libation; (mid.) exchange libations, make a truce, make peace
perceive (+ acc. or + gen.); sense, understand
come into being, be born, become; occur
fight (+ dat. of the enemy person or + prep. phrase)
exhort, encourage (+ dat. of person, sometimes + inf.)
learn, hear (sometimes + gen. of person); learn by inquiry, inquire
(+ gen.) from under, under; by (agent with passive verb or expression)
(+ dat.) under; under the power of
(+ acc.) under, during, in the course of
again; in turn; hereafter, in the future
(postpositive; emphatic particle usually anticipating a contrast with δέ)
(oblique cases) him, her, it, them; (intensive) myself, himself, herself, itself, etc; (with art.) the same
(+ gen.) down from, down upon; against (the interests of a person); concerning
(+ acc.) down along, over, throughout; in accordance with
(+ dat.) around (position); about (an object for which one struggles)
(+ gen.) over, above (of motion or position); in defense of; concerning
(+ acc.) over, across, beyond (of motion or position)
be unjust, do wrong; harm, do wrong to (someone [acc.])

lack, be in need of (+ gen.)
(active rare apart from use in certain fixed idioms)
want, be in need of (+ gen.) (more common than the active); beg, ask for (+ gen. of person + inf.)
(impersonal) there is need of (+ dat. of person and gen. of thing needed)
(commonly) seem (sometimes + dat. of person + inf.); (rarely in prose) think, suppose
be strong; rule over (+ gen.); conquer (+ acc. or gen.)
inhabit, settle; manage (a house or a government); dwell, live
put to flight; terrify, frighten; (more commonly, mid./pass.) be afraid, be afraid of (+ acc; + inf)
in this way, thus, so very
line of battle; line of hoplites
line, picture; letter (of alphabet); piece of writing
deed, action; event, circumstance, thing; (pl.) toil, trouble

man, male; warrior; husband; "real man", "man"
(in contexts emphasizing sexist or macho traits)
god, divinity; tutelary divinity, the power controlling one's destiny; one's destiny, lot

Demosthenes
(Athenian orator and philosopher, 4th cent. B.C.E.)

trireme
(a swift warship with three banks of oars)
race, stock, family; offspring; class, sort, kind
multitude; the masses, the majority; quantity; size
fulfillment, completion; end, finish; authority; (pl.) service, duty; offerings, rites; taxes
the common people; the democratic assembly; township, deme
fate; chance; fortune (good, bad, or neutral); happening, event
ask for (+ acc. of person + acc. of thing or inf.)
lead away; arrest, carry off to prison
hold off; (intrans.) be away from, be distant from
long for, desire (+ gen. of object desired)
lead, guide (usually + dat. of person); command, rule (usually + gen. of person); consider, think
lead by; lead astray, mislead; bring forward, introduce
turn, direct; change; put to flight (in battle)
guard, defend; wathc for; (mid.) be on one's guard, be on guard against (+ acc.)
